Posts.Content: crikey you are not moaning!!! i was in exactly the same position not that long ago. I had my 3rd chemo wed 20th april but i have been using the cold cap so i still have my hair. however, i can relate to how you are feeling right now. i posted something so similar. 18 days after i had my 1st chemo i started to lose my hair. id had it cut short to a pixie style so that when i used the cold cap there would be less pressure on my roots/folicles. nothing will ever quite prepare you (no matter how 'ok' you are with losing your hair) for that initial hair loss. i too felt really down about it and just spent far too much time running my fingers thru my hair panicking. what have you got for yourself? i have a wig, several bandanas (pls go to the website 'anna bandana' excellent quality and brill prices....and some really funky ideas) and i have a few wider head bands. like i said i had cold cap so i may not be in the exact position, i just hope you feel better soon. Posts.Content: Hello. I was diagnosed with breast cancer mon 10th jan and i had my op yesterday so they got me in quite quick. I had a massive shock when i was diagnosed, im 30 and healthy!! but i guess that doesnt count when it comes to cancer. My dads mum had breast cancer in her 60's (1994 ish) but the doctors didnt count that as family history....??? I had a little hard lump. sometimes really easy to locate and other times couldnt feel it at all and my mammogram didnt show anything! so, i was sent for an ultra sound and i had a peek and i knew it would be treated as suspicious (but doesnt always mean CANCER). anyway, im such a soft arse i wouldn hav put me down as a brave person but i promise u, u find strength and just get through it. accept all your loved ones support with open arms (even if they do at times badger u for reassurance). fingers crossed u get good news!!! though, i bet you have still had such a shock, all the waiting and hospital visits. Please, let us know how you get on. Take care and best wishes...clair xxx

Posts.Title: Worried about the assessment

Posts.Content: hi sally. i have been where u are and i can remember feeling the same! i was diagnosed with BC 10th jan, had op 25th and 2 weeks later told my nodes wer clear and tumour was out. I was given the option of having chemo, the oncologist pushed it a little as a ''mopping up'' then radio 3 weeks after chemo ends. I was terrified but found this site so helpful...ask questions and listen to the advice...i swear these lovely people have helped me so much! i had my 1st chemo (EC) 9th march with my 2nd tomorrow (4 in total) and out of all i have been through it was the chemo i was most frightened about. I came on here and got some really good advice about anything i was worried about at the time so ask away!!! Everyone does react different to the chemo. I got the cold cap 1st. I decided i wanted to try save my hair. 3 weeks later a little has begun to come out but its just thinned a bit. I have an excellent wig and snazzy head wear from a site called Anna Bandana (try it out, fab quality and very good prices). Im loving being the chilled out hippy chick these days haha!!! After i got home from my 1st chemo i was just a little groggy. had something to eat and a nap. i woke up sickly and i was sick, just once. then for the next few days i just felt hungover! bit of a sore throat and the odd mouth ulcer but nothing too unpleasant. after about a week i was fine! even went to a footy match!!! haha! armed with my hand sanitiser of course! last week i went out for my pals bday (no hard partying but still i got out the house!!!). im like you, i am a realist and find myself saying to myself  'just get on with it Mrs, get it out the way'...but we all have thoughts and feelings and you're allowed to have a cry and a rant...i certainly do!! my poor boyfriend just lets me get on with it and is there for me when im done!!! hahaha! Stay away from websites u dont know, if u want advice use this site or reputable ones such as NHS or Cancer Care. last thing u want to do is terrify yourself!!! when u start your treatment u will get lots of info on it all! hope you feel better soon xxx clair xxx

Posts.Title: hair strength after cold cap...advice??!!

Posts.Content: thanks ladies! i bit the bullet and got a mild dye on my hair and teased it a little with my straighteners. then yesterday i went out with my boyfriend and straightened my hair and used a bit of hair wax! i felt just like the old ME (the old me with a really funky pixie cut that i probs will keep)!!! jane, my advice is to use the cold cap from day 1! make sure its really snug on your head so that each folicle gets chilly!!! i took 2 paracetemol and ibuprofen to take the edge off! also took scarves to put round my neck to keep the cold drips off. the nurse put gauze on my ears and forehead. please persevere as the 1st 20 mins is quite uncomfortable and a very bizarre feeling! 2 and a half weeks after my 1st chemo i started losing my hair but not so u could notice. some ppl just wet their hair and let it cleanse itself but i found a fab product called NAKED. its sold in Boots Chemist and is 97% organic and my chemo nurses recommended it. its so mild and can be used thru chemo. take care and keep in touch xxx
